thinking.disposable_income: West Englewood is a low-income community with median income of $29,234, significantly below Chicago's average. 69.5% of households earn less than $50,000 annually, with 42.1% earning less than $25,000, indicating very limited disposable income
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the low income levels, residents have minimal discretionary spending capacity. Any increase in transportation costs or sales tax would significantly impact their ability to afford basic necessities
thinking.accessibility: 32.7% of households have no vehicle, and 25.9% rely on public transit for commuting. The community has high transit dependency despite longer transit travel times (58.8 minutes vs 21 minutes by car)
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized proposals with lowest transit fares ($0.75) due to high transit dependency and low incomes. 2. Favored lower sales tax rates (0.5-1.0%) to protect limited discretionary spending. 3. Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit service without overly burdening car-dependent households. 4. Balanced travel time improvements with cost impacts. 5. Selected proposals that reduce transit travel times while keeping costs affordable
